pr_title: Consume/drain the inbound in case a cancellation is received before subscription

timeline.message: Added logic to release/drain content in case a connection is cancelled before getting subscribed

timeline.bodyText: Do 304 classified as non body status code ?
timeline.author: simplynaveen20

replies.bodyText: Yes, 304 will be a non body status code
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: Do we need mayHaveBody check , what happen if we clear on all cancel irrespective of body, we can avoid extra check ?
timeline.author: simplynaveen20

replies.bodyText: Since we are draining content here, we want to make sure we drain it under very specific conditions, specially when the body can be present.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: That is fine ,but my doubt is if some valid response miss mayHaveBody  (due to any missed scenario), then we will still face issue , vs draining non body too along with body response (Its a trade off thing )
replies.author: simplynaveen20

timeline.bodyText: I think some of 4xx error codes from Cosmos (e.g., 400 query plan) also have body.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Would these be considered as error or success ?
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: this condition is already returning true for 4xx, isn't ?
replies.author: simplynaveen20

timeline.message: Selecting tradeoff to drain body in all cases when cancellation has happened before subscription
